title: Love Island's Jess Shears and Dom Lever welcome first child together
text:
The pair have been together since Love Island 2017 (Pictures: Instagram/REX)

Love Island’s Jessica Shears and Dom Lever have welcomed their first child together.

Jess told fans the happy news, sharing an adorable photo of their little one sleeping, writing: ‘Baby Lever ♥️’ and tagging her beau in the snap.

Meanwhile, Dom shared a sweet snap of himself carrying the baby back to the car, writing: ‘Baby we did it [heart emoji].’

So sweet!

Fans and friends have been quick to congratulate the couple, with fellow islander and West End star Amber Davies writing: ‘Congratulations 😍’ and Joe Garratt saying: ‘Congratulations Bro.’

Chris Hughes added: ‘Congrats mate x,’ while Mario Falcone told Dom: ‘Congratulations bro x’.

Just four hours before the baby snaps were posted, Dom was out on the football field having a kickabout and ticking off his to-do list: ‘Barber, gym, sunbed, Costa, football.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

It seems ‘have a baby’ wasn’t on there, but we’re sure he’s not complaining about how his day turned out.

Meanwhile, Jess has recently seemed a bit done with pregnancy, after she posted a throwback selfie.

‘Throwback,’ she wrote. ‘Can’t wait not to have a swollen face and 1000 chins.’

The couple, who met on Love Island 2017, got engaged three months after leaving the Majorcan villa, later getting married in Mykonos.

They then announced they were expecting a child, alongside picture of their first scan and held their respective ‘bumps.’

Dom was on the football field earlier today (Picture: Instagram/DomLever)

Jess, 26, wrote to her followers: ‘The best is yet to come’ while husband Dom, 28, added: ‘Living the dream.’

However, clearly incredibly loved-up, Dom went a step further to show his affection for his partner, unveiling plans for a huge tattoo of her face earlier this year.

The unusual tattoo, which shows Jess inside a bear’s mouth (we have no idea) proved he was in it for ‘the long haul’, according to him.

We probably could have guessed that from the baby but each to their own, eh?
